page.title: 12RECREATION AND TOURISM
page.content:
On Saturday 10th October,1985 people were observed taking part in the following{activities: WALKING, EXERCISING DOGS, PICKING BLACKBERRIES, HORSE RIDING, HANG GLIDING, The most important activity in the area is{walking}and East Hill Strips is the most popular area offering fine views of the Otter Valley. There are approximately 20miles of regularly used{footpaths}in the block and several publications advertise walks.
Local people make most use of the area for recreation but a large car park on East Hill encourages the tourist to enjoy the area as well. Footpaths are the only{managed recreational facilities in the block. {Hunting}is an important pursuit for many local people.
